summary: This is a standard Office of the Inspector General (OIG) interview waiver form, used to inform an employee that they are being asked to provide information voluntarily as part of an investigation. The form includes warnings, assurances, and a waiver section for the employee to sign, indicating their understanding and willingness to participate. The specific subject of the investigation is partially redacted.
keyFacts: The document is an OIG Form III.226/2 (dated 05/03/21) used for voluntary employee interviews.
The investigation is conducted by the Office of the Inspector General pursuant to the Inspector General Act of 1978.
The specific subject of the investigation is redacted in the text.

The form assures the employee that the interview is voluntary, no disciplinary action will be taken for refusing to answer, and any statement may be used in future criminal or disciplinary proceedings.
The form includes a waiver section for the employee to sign, confirming no coercion was used.
